intro: Meriania arizae, commonly known as the Arizona meriania, is a flowering plant native to the Sonoran Desert region of the United States and Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are usually narrow and leathery, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh conditions. Meriania arizae plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various desert wildlife.
